groups.group_header: May we contact you about free screenings and community programs or motivational message?

sections.section_title: TSSC Enrollment | Nutrition and Physical Activity Questionnaire

questions.question_text: INFORMED CONSENT TO TAKE PART IN PROGRAM EVALUATION
INFORMED CONSENT TO TAKE PART IN PROGRAM EVALUATION
INFORMED CONSENT TO TAKE PART IN PROGRAM EVALUATION
BP reading is hypertensive. Did you refer participant to PCP?
Has participant received TSSC Welcome Flyer?
Which TSSC components has this participant received?
May we contact you about free screenings and community programs or motivational message?
Have you received a flu vaccine THIS FLU SEASON (anytime since August)?
If yes, did you receive a flu vaccine from  Tu Salud ¡Si Cuenta!?
If “Yes” please indicate the type of insurance you have
What is your yearly household income from all sources? Family size income
Is your yearly houshold income from all sources greater than the amount indicated above?
Has a physician ever diagnosed you with Diabetes?
How many portions of fruit (of any sort) do you eat on a typical day?
How many portions of vegetables (excluding potatoes) do you eat on a typical day?

If you report that you do not eat 5 or more regular servings of fruits and vegetables every day, do you intend to change what you eat so you will eat at least 5 servings of fruits and vegetables every day?
*** READ THIS TO THE PARTICIPANT BEFORE YOU ASK QUESTIONS

We are interested in 3 types of physical activity: STRENUOUS, MODERATE, AND MILD. Strenuous activities cause large increase in breathing or hear rate while moderate activities cause small increase in breathing or heart rate. Mild activities require minimal efforts. We will ask you separately about each type of activity.

During a typical 7-day period (a week), how many times a week on an average do you do strenuous exercise where your heart beats rapidly (e.g. running, jogging, football, soccer, basketball, roller skating, vigorous swimming, vigorous long distance bicycling) for more than 10 minutes during your free time?
On occasion when you do strenuous exercise, what is average number of minutes you exercise?

During a typical 7-day period (a week), how many times a week on an average do you do moderate exercise, not exhausting (e.g. fast walking, baseball, tennis, easy bicycling, dancing) for more than 10 minutes during your free time?
On occasion when you do moderate exercise, what is average number of minutes you exercise?

During a typical 7-day period (a week), how many times a week on an average do you do mild exercise, requiring minimal effort (e.g. yoga, fishing from river bank, bowling, golf, easy walking) for more than 10 minutes during your free time?
On occasion when you do mild exercise, what is average number of minutes you exercise?
In a typical week, how much time on average do you spend sitting daily?
Based on the information you provided me about your physical activity, how many minutes of moderate or strenuous physical activity do you usually perform every week?

If you perform less than 30 minutes of physical activity every day, do you intend to change your physical activity routine so you will perform at least 30 minutes of moderate or strenuous physical activity 5 days a week?
If you reported that you have been doing moderate or strenuous physical activity for 30 minutes or more 5 days a week. For how many months have you been doing it?
Has the participant completed the HHSC evaluation?
Does the participant wish to continue with follow-up visits?

options: Participant was too busy for the program
Participant has other family matters to attend to

questions.question_text: Would you like to screen for our DPP program?

We have a new study that will be starting soon that involves completing questionnaires at enrollment, 6 months and 9 months. This study will be evaluating Tu Salud Si Cuenta and new components. If you would like to participate in this, you will be provided with incentives during the 3 different timepoints (for a total of $75) and your participation will help us improve services in the community.
I am giving permission to be contacted for new study
Participant enrolled in or referred by Salud y Vida?

May we contact you about free screening & community programs or 
 motivational messages through text message and/or email?

options: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

questions.question_text: Do you rent or own your home?
How many people live with you (total household size)?
What is your household income from all sources (in US dollar)?
Is your yearly household income from all sources greater than any amount indicated above?
If yes, please indicate the type of insurance you have?
Is participant being screened for DPP or TSSC?

sections.section_title: TSSC Followup | Nutrition and Physical Activity Questionnaire

questions.question_text: BP reading is hypertensive. Did you refer participant to PCP?
Location where BP and BMI were taken
Select which of the following modules the Participant has received at the follow-up visit.
Did you refer participant to exercise class due to BMI?
Is there anything that worries you about your health in general, or anything in particular you would like to improve?
Categorize the behavior change into one of the following lifestyle modifications.
options: Increased fruit and vegetable consumption (DASH eating plan)

questions.question_text: What are the disadvantages and advantages of making a change?
If you make changes, how would your life be different from what it is today? How would you like to turn out for you in 2 years?
How would you accomplish your goal?
When do you plan to start?
On a scale of 1 to 10, where 1 is “Definitely Not Ready” and a 10 is “Definitely Ready”, how ready are you to change right now?
On a scale of 1 to 10, where 1 is “Not Confident” and a 10 is “Very Confident”, how confident do you fell that you can change?
How many portions of fruit (of any sort) do you eat on a typical day?
How many portions of vegetables (excluding potatoes) do you eat on a typical day?

If you report that you do not eat 5 or more regular servings of fruits and vegetables every day, do you intend to change what you eat so you will eat at least 5 servings of fruits and vegetables every day?
*** READ THIS TO THE PARTICIPANT BEFORE YOU ASK QUESTIONS

We are interested in 3 types of physical activity: STRENUOUS, MODERATE, AND MILD. Strenuous activities cause large increase in breathing or hear rate while moderate activities cause small increase in breathing or heart rate. Mild activities require minimal efforts. We will ask you separately about each type of activity.

During a typical 7-day period (a week), how many times a week on an average do you do strenuous exercise where your heart beats rapidly (e.g. running, jogging, football, soccer, basketball, roller skating, vigorous swimming, vigorous long distance bicycling) for more than 10 minutes during your free time?
On occasion when you do strenuous exercise, what is average number of minutes you exercise?

During a typical 7-day period (a week), how many times a week on an average do you do moderate exercise, not exhausting (e.g. fast walking, baseball, tennis, easy bicycling, dancing) for more than 10 minutes during your free time?
On occasion when you do moderate exercise, what is average number of minutes you exercise?

During a typical 7-day period (a week), how many times a week on an average do you do mild exercise, requiring minimal effort (e.g. yoga, fishing from river bank, bowling, golf, easy walking) for more than 10 minutes during your free time?
On occasion when you do mild exercise, what is average number of minutes you exercise?
In a typical week, how much time on average do you spend sitting daily?
Based on the information you provided me about your physical activity, how many minutes of moderate or strenuous physical activity do you usually perform every week?

If you perform less than 30 minutes of physical activity every day, do you intend to change your physical activity routine so you will perform at least 30 minutes of moderate or strenuous physical activity 5 days a week?
If you reported that you have been doing moderate or strenuous physical activity for 30 minutes or more 5 days a week. For how many months have you been doing it?
Does the participant wish to continue with follow-up visits?

options: Participant was too busy for the program
Participant has other family matters to attend to

*** READ THIS TO THE PARTICIPANT BEFORE YOU ASK QUESTIONS

We are interested in 3 types of physical activity: STRENUOUS, MODERATE, AND MILD. Strenuous activities cause large increase in breathing or hear rate while moderate activities cause small increase in breathing or heart rate. Mild activities require minimal efforts. We will ask you separately about each type of activity.

During a typical 7-day period (a week), how many times a week on an average do you do strenuous exercise where your heart beats rapidly (e.g. running, jogging, football, soccer, basketball, roller skating, vigorous swimming, vigorous long distance bicycling) for more than 10 minutes during your free time?
On occasion when you do strenuous exercise, what is average number of minutes you exercise?

During a typical 7-day period (a week), how many times a week on an average do you do moderate exercise, not exhausting (e.g. fast walking, baseball, tennis, easy bicycling, dancing) for more than 10 minutes during your free time?
On occasion when you do moderate exercise, what is average number of minutes you exercise?

During a typical 7-day period (a week), how many times a week on an average do you do mild exercise, requiring minimal effort (e.g. yoga, fishing from river bank, bowling, golf, easy walking) for more than 10 minutes during your free time?
On occasion when you do mild exercise, what is average number of minutes you exercise?
In a typical week, how much time on average do you spend sitting daily?
Based on the information you provided me about your physical activity, how many minutes of moderate or strenuous physical activity do you usually perform every week?

If you perform less than 30 minutes of physical activity every day, do you intend to change your physical activity routine so you will perform at least 30 minutes of moderate or strenuous physical activity 5 days a week?
If you reported that you have been doing moderate or strenuous physical activity for 30 minutes or more 5 days a week. For how many months have you been doing it?
In the last month, how often have you felt that you were unable to control the important things in your life?
In the last month, how often have you felt confident about your ability to handle your personal problems?
In the last month, how often have you felt that things were going your way?
In the last month, how often have you felt difficulties were piling up so high that you could not overcome them?
Have you ever been told by a doctor that you have fatty liver disease (NAFLD/NASH)?

During the last 3 months, how often did you usually have any kind of drink containing alcohol? By a drink we mean half an ounce of absolute alcohol (e.g. a 12 ounce can or glass of beer or wine cooler, a 5 ounce glass of wine, or a drink containing 1 shot of liquor). Choose only one.?
options: Less than one day a month
I did not drink any alcohol in the 3 months, but I did drink in the past
I never drank any alcohol in my life

questions.question_text: During the last 3 months, how many drinks containing alcohol including beer, wine or liquor did you have on a typical day when you drank alcohol? Choose only one.

MEN ONLY (65 AND YOUNGER) During the past 3 months, how often did you have five or more drinks containing alcohol on the same occasion (i.e., at the same time or within a couple of hours of each other)? [That would be the equivalent of at least 5 12-ounce cans or bottles of beer, 5 five-ounce glasses of wine, or 5 drinks each containing one shot of liquor]
options: Less than one day a month

questions.question_text: FOR WOMEN OR PERSONS OVER THE AGE OF 65: have four or more drinks containing alcohol on the same occasion (i.e., at the same time or within a couple of hours of each other)? [That would be the equivalent of at least 4 12-ounce cans or bottles of beer; 4 five-ounce glasses of wine; 4 drinks each containing one shot of liquor or spirits]
options: Less than one day a month

questions.question_text: Does the participant wish to continue with follow-up visits?

options: Participant was too busy for the program
Participant has other family matters to attend to

During the last 3 months, how often did you usually have any kind of drink containing alcohol? By a drink we mean half an ounce of absolute alcohol (e.g. a 12 ounce can or glass of beer or wine cooler, a 5 ounce glass of wine, or a drink containing 1 shot of liquor). Choose only one.?
options: Less than one day a month
I did not drink any alcohol in the 3 months, but I did drink in the past
I never drank any alcohol in my life

MEN ONLY (65 AND YOUNGER) During the past 3 months, how often did you have five or more drinks containing alcohol on the same occasion (i.e., at the same time or within a couple of hours of each other)? questions.question_text: What is your living situation today?
options: I have a steady place to live
I have a place to live today, but I am worried about losing it in the future

I do not have a steady place to live (I am temporarily staying with others, in a hotel, in a shelter, living outside on the street, on a beach, in a car, abandoned building, bus or train station, or in a park)

questions.question_text: Think about the place you live. Do you have problems with any of the following (CHOOSE ALL THAT APPLY):
options: No refrigerator or refrigerator not working

questions.question_text: Within the past 12 months, you worried that your food would run out before you got money to buy more.
Within the past 12 months, the food you bought just didn't last and you didn't have money to get more.
In the past 12 months, has lack of reliable transportation kept you from medical appointments, meetings work or from getting things needed for daily living?
In the past 12 months has the electric, gas, oil, or water company threatened to shut off services at your home?
How often does anyone, including family and friends, physically hurt you?
How often does anyone, including family and friends, insult or talk down to you?
How often does anyone, including family and friends, threaten you with harm?
How often does anyone, including family and friends, scream or curse at you?
Does the participant wish to continue with follow-up visits?

options: Participant was too busy for the program
Participant has other family matters to attend to

sections.section_title: DPP Enrollment| Nutrition and Physical Activity Questionnaire
DPP Enrollment | SDOH Questionnaire (Social Determinants of Health)

questions.question_text: Who is the primary payer for your participation in this National DPP LCP?
Who or what motivated you the most to sign up for this program. What was the most influential factor?
options: Someone at a community-based organization (church, community center, fitness center)
Current of past participant in the National DPP LCP
Media advertisements (social media, flyer, brochure, radio ad, billboard, etc.)

questions.question_text: Did a healthcare professional ask you to join this program?
If “Yes” please indicate the type of insurance you have:
Current address(please confirm address displayed below)
Do you rent or own your home?
How many people live with you (total household members?)
What is your household income from all sources (in US Dollars)?
What is your yearly household income from all sources (family size income)?
Within your family, is there any history of?
Heart attack under the age of 50
How many portions of fruit (of any sort) do you eat on a typical day?
How many portions of vegetables (excluding potatoes) do you eat on a typical day?

If you report that you do not eat 5 or more regular servings of fruits and vegetables every day, do you intend to change what you eat so you will eat at least 5 servings of fruits and vegetables every day?
*** READ THIS TO THE PARTICIPANT BEFORE YOU ASK QUESTIONS

We are interested in 3 types of physical activity: STRENUOUS, MODERATE, AND MILD. Strenuous activities cause large increase in breathing or hear rate while moderate activities cause small increase in breathing or heart rate. Mild activities require minimal efforts. We will ask you separately about each type of activity.

During a typical 7-day period (a week), how many times a week on an average do you do strenuous exercise where your heart beats rapidly (e.g. running, jogging, football, soccer, basketball, roller skating, vigorous swimming, vigorous long distance bicycling) for more than 10 minutes during your free time?
On occasion when you do strenuous exercise, what is average number of minutes you exercise?

During a typical 7-day period (a week), how many times a week on an average do you do moderate exercise, not exhausting (e.g. fast walking, baseball, tennis, easy bicycling, dancing) for more than 10 minutes during your free time?
On occasion when you do moderate exercise, what is average number of minutes you exercise?

During a typical 7-day period (a week), how many times a week on an average do you do mild exercise, requiring minimal effort (e.g. yoga, fishing from river bank, bowling, golf, easy walking) for more than 10 minutes during your free time?
On occasion when you do mild exercise, what is average number of minutes you exercise?
In a typical week, how much time on average do you spend sitting daily?
Based on the information you provided me about your physical activity, how many minutes of moderate or strenuous physical activity do you usually perform every week?

If you perform less than 30 minutes of physical activity every day, do you intend to change your physical activity routine so you will perform at least 30 minutes of moderate or strenuous physical activity 5 days a week?
If you reported that you have been doing moderate or strenuous physical activity for 30 minutes or more 5 days a week. For how many months have you been doing it?
Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems? Read each item carefully and select your response.
Little interest or pleasure in doing things
Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much
Feeling tired or having little energy
Feeling bad about yourself - or that you are a failure or have let yourself or your family down
Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching television
Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed? Or the opposite - being so fidgety or restless that you have been moving a lot more than usual?
Thoughts that you would be better off dead or of hurting yourself in some way
If you checked off any problems, how difficult have these problems made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people?
Has your doctor ever said that you have a heart condition and that you should only perform physical activity recommended by a doctor?
Do you feel pain in your chest when you perform physical activity?
In the past month, have you had chest pain when you were not performing any physical activity?
Do you lose your balance because of dizziness, or do you ever lose consciousness?
Do you have a bone or joint problem that could be made worse by a change in your physical activity?
Is your doctor currently prescribing any medication for your blood pressure or for a heart condition?
Do you know of any other reason why you should not engage in physical activity?
Did you answer "yes" to any of the previous questions?
Do you have a medical release?
Please consult your physician before engaging in physical activity and seek advice from your physician on what type of activity is suitable for your current condition.
What is your living situation today?
options: I have a steady place to live
I have a place to live today, but I am worried about losing it in the future

I do not have a steady place to live (I am temporarily staying with others, in a hotel, in a shelter, living outside on the street, on a beach, in a car, abandoned building, bus or train station, or in a park)

questions.question_text: Think about the place you live. Do you have problems with any of the following (CHOOSE ALL THAT APPLY):
options: No refrigerator or refrigerator not working

questions.question_text: Within the past 12 months, you worried that your food would run out before you got money to buy more.
Within the past 12 months, the food you bought just didn't last and you didn't have money to get more.
In the past 12 months, has lack of reliable transportation kept you from medical appointments, meetings work or from getting things needed for daily living?
In the past 12 months has the electric, gas, oil, or water company threatened to shut off services at your home?
How often does anyone, including family and friends, physically hurt you?
How often does anyone, including family and friends, insult or talk down to you?
How often does anyone, including family and friends, threaten you with harm?
How often does anyone, including family and friends, scream or curse at you?
The presenter delivered the material in a clear and structured manner
The presenter was knowledgeable about the topic and any related issues
The presenter maintained my interest during the entire presentation
The presenter was enthusiastic about the topic.
The presenter was well organized and prepared.
The information was concise and informative.
The presentation content was practical and useful, and the techniques applied to current information.
Overall, I would rate this presentation/instructor as

sections.section_title: DPP Screening | CDC Prediabetes Risk Test

questions.question_text: Has a physician ever diagnosed you with Diabetes?
How did you hear about us?
Are you a man or a woman?
Have you ever been diagnosed with gestestional diabetes?
Do you have a mother, father, sister or brother with diabetes?
Have you ever been diagnosed with high blood pressure?
You are eligible for the program if your BMI ≥ 25 and you meet at least ONE of the following 3 criteria:
A CDC Prediabetes Screening Risk Test score of ≥ 5
questions.label: A CDC Prediabetes Screening Risk Test score of ≥ 5

questions.question_text: Have a previous diagnosis of gestational diabetes
